channel.title: jimgrisham tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from jimgrisham.

item.description: Given the timing of its release, one must wonder if today’s 5-4 #SCOTUS ruling in #Oklahoma v. #Castro_Huerta was decided mostly for concern over justice in #IndianCountry, or rather as a hedge against tribal governments allowing #abortions to be performed in their territories.
@BenSharmaTO https://t.co/6Tfjw3KzQA
@TheClutterer https://t.co/6Tfjw3KzQA
@Brey112 https://t.co/6Tfjw3KzQA
@sukatra https://t.co/6Tfjw3KzQA
@alexpalen1 @McFaul https://t.co/6Tfjw3KzQA
@mzedp @igorsushko Did they just take the panels and leave the conduit? That looks like a whole lot of dirt where there should be panels of a consistent color.
@CornishMiner186 @FabSpiderCrab @PhillipsPOBrien Apparently the “Enhanced Border Security and Visa Entry Reform Act of 2002” is to thank: https://t.co/FIgCXNAGA9

@HeyTweetJon @SkepticalGinger In the USN at least, one would simply hold the salute until passing the higher-ranking officer and then drop it, just as if the admiral’s back was turned toward the person saluting or if that person were passing / passed by the national ensign (flag).

@SkepticalGinger @DruidicFireball If someone is too careless to perform something as simple as a salute, what other things might they slip up on later? It’s not like you dropped the kid for push-ups on tarmac, after all.

@Pr1nceOfDarknes @TrentTelenko You’re right - repeated attacks can be an effective (and demoralizing*) denial strategy. (* as any one who has ever tried tidying the play area of a toddler has experienced)

@markproxy It’s refreshing to see large cities starting to find success here! Excerpt: ‘The delay for finding permanent housing for a homeless veteran dropped from an average of _720 days_ a decade ago to just 32 days today.’

@markproxy It looks like (for now) it’s only the HQ staff moving and _not_ the factory? If so, it seems a bit of a red herring to blame worker’s comp issues, unless they’re seeing excessive claims for papercuts and carpel tunnel syndrome…
@ClimateKev @hausfath @meinshausen @Laura_Cozzi_ @IEA #Blaze, said Gaia? https://t.co/udmPSUDQTo

@thesarahkelly It’s sad they couldn’t agree to re-purpose one of the existing ‘N11’ codes for this. I fear some may try dialing ‘998’ instead of ‘988’ when in crisis. PSA: the existing toll-free number (to which 988 forwards) will continue to function indefinitely: https://t.co/8cFx7CXuP5
@1karipilled @muttmoder A small library near where my grandparents lived loans has loaned out _framed artwork_ since at least the 1980s!

@dantose @Lamergier2 @RyanRadia @the_transit_guy Many of the ‘standard-speed’ long-distance @Amtrak routes are already booked at 90% or more capacity for this month. (that’s not normal, and likely due to high petrol and airfare prices, but it shows that plenty of people are willing to take up to 2.5 day! trips at times)
